methods.name: type
methods.sourceCode: type 	^ FFIUInt8

methods.name: type
methods.sourceCode: type	^ FFIUInt32

methods.name: copyWith:
methods.sourceCode: copyWith: newElement	"Answer a new collection with newElement added (as last	element if sequenceable)."	^ self copy		add: newElement;		yourself

methods.name: reject:thenCollect:
methods.sourceCode: reject: rejectBlock thenCollect: collectBlock	"Utility method to improve readability."	^ (self reject: rejectBlock) collect: collectBlock

methods.name: stonOn:
methods.sourceCode: stonOn: stonWriter	"For collections we chose to write a list of elements as delivered by #do:	This is not the best or most correct solution for all subclasses though,	so some will revert to standard object behavior or chose another solution"		stonWriter writeObject: self do: [		stonWriter encodeList: self ]

methods.name: collect:thenDo:
methods.sourceCode: collect: collectBlock thenDo: doBlock 	"Utility method to improve readability."		^ self do: [ :each|		doBlock value: (collectBlock value: each)]

methods.name: flatCollect:
methods.sourceCode: flatCollect: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock for each of the receiver's elements and answer the	list of all resulting values flatten one level. Assumes that aBlock returns some kind	of collection for each element. Equivalent to the lisp's mapcan"		"( #((3 4) (1 2)) flatCollect: [:each | each ] )>>> #(3 4 1 2)"	"( #(3 4 1 2) flatCollect: [:each | { each } ] ) >>> #(3 4 1 2)"		^ self flatCollect: aBlock as: self species

methods.name: cos
methods.sourceCode: cos	^self collect: [:each | each cos]

methods.name: removeFromMetacelloRepositories:
methods.sourceCode: removeFromMetacelloRepositories: aMetacelloRepositoriesSpec	self do: [:each | each removeFromMetacelloRepositories: aMetacelloRepositoriesSpec ]

methods.name: asCharacterSet
methods.sourceCode: asCharacterSet	"Answer a CharacterSet whose elements are the unique elements of the receiver.	The reciever should only contain characters."	^ CharacterSet newFrom: self

methods.name: addAll:
methods.sourceCode: addAll: aCollection 	"Include all the elements of aCollection as the receiver's elements. Answer 	aCollection. Actually, any object responding to #do: can be used as argument."	aCollection do: [:each | self add: each].	^ aCollection

methods.name: removeAllFoundIn:
methods.sourceCode: removeAllFoundIn: aCollection 	"Remove each element of aCollection which is present in the receiver 	from the receiver. Answer aCollection. No error is raised if an element	isn't found. ArrayedCollections cannot respond to this message."	aCollection do: [:each | self remove: each ifAbsent: []].	^ aCollection
- arg	^ arg adaptToCollection: self andSend: #-

methods.name: asDraggableMorph
methods.sourceCode: asDraggableMorph	^ (String streamContents: [ :s| 		self 			do: [ :each | s print: each ]			separatedBy: [ s space ]]) asStringMorph

methods.name: gtDebuggerSUnitPrint
methods.sourceCode: gtDebuggerSUnitPrint	^ String streamContents: [ :s | 		  self asStringOn: s delimiter: String cr ]

methods.name: do:
methods.sourceCode: do: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument."	self subclassResponsibility

methods.name: raisedTo:
methods.sourceCode: raisedTo: arg	^ arg adaptToCollection: self andSend: #raisedTo:

methods.name: asOrderedCollection
methods.sourceCode: asOrderedCollection	"Answer an OrderedCollection whose elements are the elements of the	receiver. The order in which elements are added depends on the order	in which the receiver enumerates its elements. In the case of unordered	collections, the ordering is not necessarily the same for multiple 	requests for the conversion."	^ self as: OrderedCollection

methods.name: sum
methods.sourceCode: sum	"This is implemented using a variant of the normal inject:into: pattern. 	The reason for this is that it is not known whether we're in the normal 	number line, i.e. whether 0 is a good initial value for the sum. 	Consider a collection of measurement objects, 0 would be the unitless 	value and would not be appropriate to add with the unit-ed objects."	| sum sample |		self emptyCheck.	sample := self anyOne.	sum := self inject: sample into: [:accum :each | accum + each].	^ sum - sample

methods.name: gtInspectorInterestingObject
methods.sourceCode: gtInspectorInterestingObject	^ self size = 1		ifTrue: [ self anyOne ]		ifFalse: [ self ]

methods.name: copyWithoutDuplicates
methods.sourceCode: copyWithoutDuplicates	"Answer a copy of the receiver without any duplicated elements"	"(#(2 3 4 4  5 6) copyWithoutDuplicates)  >>> #(2 3 4 5 6)"	"(#('do' 'la' 'si' 'do' 'la') copyWithoutDuplicates) >>> #('la' 'do' 'si')"	"(#(#do #la #si #do #la) copyWithoutDuplicates) >>> #(#la #do #si)"	^ self asSet asArray
// arg	^ arg adaptToCollection: self andSend: #//

methods.name: copyWithout:
methods.sourceCode: copyWithout: oldElement 	"Answer a copy of the receiver that does not contain any	elements equal to oldElement."	"('fred the bear' copyWithout: $e) >>> 'frd th bar'"	"(#(2 3 4 5 5 6) copyWithout: 5) >>> #(2 3 4 6)"			^ self reject: [:each | each = oldElement]

methods.name: floor
methods.sourceCode: floor	^ self collect: [:a | a floor]

methods.name: negated
methods.sourceCode: negated	"Negated value of all elements in the collection"	"#(1 2 3) negated >>> #(-1 -2 -3)"	^ self collect: [:a | a negated]

methods.name: do:separatedBy:
methods.sourceCode: do: elementBlock separatedBy: separatorBlock	"Evaluate the elementBlock for all elements in the receiver,	and evaluate the separatorBlock between."	"(String streamContents: [:s | #(1 2 3) do: [:each | s << each asString] separatedBy: [s << ', ']]) >>> '1, 2, 3'"	| beforeFirst | 	beforeFirst := true.	self do:		[:each |		beforeFirst			ifTrue: [beforeFirst := false]			ifFalse: [separatorBlock value].		elementBlock value: each]

methods.name: reject:thenDo:
methods.sourceCode: reject: rejectBlock thenDo: doBlock 	"Utility method to improve readability.	Do not create the intermediate collection."		self do: [ :each |		(rejectBlock value: each)			ifFalse: [ doBlock value: each ] ].

methods.name: collect:thenSelect:
methods.sourceCode: collect: collectBlock thenSelect: selectBlock	"Utility method to improve readability."	^ (self collect: collectBlock) select: selectBlock

methods.name: asStringOn:delimiter:
methods.sourceCode: asStringOn: aStream delimiter: delimString	"Print elements on a stream separated	with a delimiter String like: 'a, b, c'	Uses #asString instead of #print:."	self do: [:elem | aStream nextPutAll: elem asString]		separatedBy: [aStream nextPutAll: delimString]

methods.name: errorSizeMismatch
methods.sourceCode: errorSizeMismatch	"Signal a SizeMismatch exception"	SizeMismatch signal

methods.name: asStringOn:delimiter:last:
methods.sourceCode: asStringOn: aStream delimiter: delimString last: lastDelimString	"Print elements on a stream separated	with a delimiter between all the elements and with	a special one before the last like: 'a, b and c'.	Uses #asString instead of #print:	Note: Feel free to improve the code to detect the last element."	| n sz |	n := 1.	sz := self size.	self do: [:elem |		n := n + 1.		aStream nextPutAll: elem asString]	separatedBy: [		aStream nextPutAll: (n = sz ifTrue: [lastDelimString] ifFalse: [delimString])]

methods.name: addIfNotPresent:ifPresentDo:
methods.sourceCode: addIfNotPresent: anObject ifPresentDo: aBlock	"Include anObject as one of the receiver's elements and then value aBlock, but only if there	is no such element already. Anwser anObject."	(self includes: anObject) 		ifFalse: [ self add: anObject ]		ifTrue: [ aBlock value ].	^ anObject

methods.name: averageIfEmpty:
methods.sourceCode: averageIfEmpty: aBlock 	"This method return the average of the collection if it is not empty. In the other case,	it return the value of the block. It means the user the user of this method decide of the return value. #() averageIfEmpty: [ 0 ]"	self ifEmpty: [ ^ aBlock value ].	^ self average

methods.name: difference:
methods.sourceCode: difference: aCollection	"Answer the set theoretic difference of two collections. Pay attention that the difference is not commutative, hence the order is important."	"(#(a b c d e f) difference:  #(a b z k))>>> #(#f #d #e #c)"	"(#(a b z k) difference: #(a b c d e f)) >>> #(#k #z)"	| set |	set := self asSet		removeAllFoundIn: aCollection;		yourself.	^ self species withAll: set asArray

methods.name: adaptToCollection:andSend:
methods.sourceCode: adaptToCollection: rcvr andSend: selector	"If I am involved in arithmetic with another Collection, return a Collection of	the results of each element combined with the scalar in that expression."	(rcvr isSequenceable and: [ self isSequenceable ]) ifFalse:		[self error: 'Only sequenceable collections may be combined arithmetically'].	^ rcvr with: self collect:		[:rcvrElement :myElement | rcvrElement perform: selector with: myElement]

methods.name: includesAny:
methods.sourceCode: includesAny: aCollection 	"Answer whether any element of aCollection is one of the receiver's elements."	aCollection do: [:elem | (self includes: elem) ifTrue: [^ true]].	^ false

methods.name: inspectionItems:
methods.sourceCode: inspectionItems: aBuilder	<inspectorPresentationOrder: 0 title: 'Items'> 		^ aBuilder newTable				addColumn: (SpIndexTableColumn new 			title: 'Index';			sortFunction: #yourself ascending;			beNotExpandable;			yourself);		addColumn: (SpStringTableColumn new  			title: 'Value'; 			evaluated: [ :each | StObjectPrinter asTruncatedTextFrom: each ];			sortFunction: #printString ascending;			yourself);		items: self asOrderedCollection;		yourself

methods.name: flattened
methods.sourceCode: flattened	"Flattens a collection of collections (no matter how many levels of collections exist). Strings are considered atoms and, as such, won't be flattened"	"( #(1 #(2 3) #(4 #(5))) flattened ) >>> #(1 2 3 4 5)" 	"( #('string1' #('string2' 'string3')) flattened ) >>> #('string1' 'string2' 'string3')"		^ Array streamContents: [ :stream | self flattenOn: stream].

methods.name: max
methods.sourceCode: max	"Return the maximum value of the collection		Example of use:	#(1 5 10 -4) max >>> 10	"	^ self inject: self anyOne into: [:max :each | max max: each]

methods.name: detect:ifNone:
methods.sourceCode: detect: aBlock ifNone: exceptionBlock	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument.  	Answer the first element for which aBlock evaluates to true. If none  	evaluate to true, then evaluate the argument, exceptionBlock."	^ self detect: aBlock ifFound: [ :element | element ] ifNone: exceptionBlock

methods.name: asCommaString
methods.sourceCode: asCommaString    "Return collection printed as 'a, b, c' "    "#( 'a' 'b' 'c') asCommaString >>> 'a, b, c'"        ^String streamContents: [:s | self asStringOn: s delimiter: ', ']

methods.name: remove:ifAbsent:
methods.sourceCode: remove: oldObject ifAbsent: anExceptionBlock 	"Remove oldObject from the receiver's elements. If several of the 	elements are equal to oldObject, only one is removed. If no element is 	equal to oldObject, answer the result of evaluating anExceptionBlock. 	Otherwise, answer the argument, oldObject. ArrayedCollections cannot 	respond to this message."	self subclassResponsibility

methods.name: errorEmptyCollection
methods.sourceCode: errorEmptyCollection	"Signal a CollectionIsEmpty exception"	CollectionIsEmpty signalWith: self

methods.name: removeFromMetacelloPackages:
methods.sourceCode: removeFromMetacelloPackages: aMetacelloPackagesSpec	self do: [:each | each removeFromMetacelloPackages: aMetacelloPackagesSpec ]

methods.name: min
methods.sourceCode: min	^ self inject: self anyOne into: [:min :each | min min: each]

methods.name: asGCoordinates
methods.sourceCode: asGCoordinates	^ GCoordinates withCollection: self

methods.name: tan
methods.sourceCode: tan	^self collect: [:each | each tan]

methods.name: gtCollectionSizeThreshold
methods.sourceCode: gtCollectionSizeThreshold	"Return the maximum collection size that GT supports while showing all elements.	When this threshold is reached, we no longer show certain views that would take too much resources."	^ 16rFFFF "65535"

methods.name: gather:
methods.sourceCode: gather: aBlock	"This method is kept for compatibility reasons, use flatCollect: instead."		^ self flatCollect: aBlock.

methods.name: sign
methods.sourceCode: sign	"Answer 1 if the receiver is greater than 0, -1 if less than 0, else 0."	"5 sign >>> 1"	"-3 sign >>> -1"	^self collect: [:each | each sign]

methods.name: printOn:delimiter:
methods.sourceCode: printOn: aStream delimiter: delimString	"Print elements on a stream separated	with a delimiter String like: 'a, b, c' "	self do: [:elem | aStream print: elem] separatedBy: [aStream nextPutAll: delimString]

methods.name: isCollection
methods.sourceCode: isCollection	"Return true if the receiver is some sort of Collection and responds to basic collection messages such as #size and #do:"	^true

methods.name: storeOn:
methods.sourceCode: storeOn: aStream 	"Refer to the comment in Object|storeOn:."	| noneYet |	aStream nextPutAll: '(('.	aStream nextPutAll: self class name.	aStream nextPutAll: ' new)'.	noneYet := true.	self do: 		[:each | 		noneYet			ifTrue: [noneYet := false]			ifFalse: [aStream nextPut: $;].		aStream nextPutAll: ' add: '.		aStream store: each].	noneYet ifFalse: [aStream nextPutAll: '; yourself'].	aStream nextPut: $)

methods.name: execute:against:
methods.sourceCode: execute: projectSpecBlock against: aScriptExecutor    aScriptExecutor executeCollection: self do: projectSpecBlock

methods.name: select:
methods.sourceCode: select: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument. Collect into a new collection like the receiver, only those elements for which aBlock evaluates to true. Answer the new collection."	"(#(1 2 3 4 5) select: #even) >>> #(2 4)"		| newCollection |	newCollection := self copyEmpty.	self do: [ :each | 		(aBlock value: each) 			ifTrue: [ newCollection add: each ]].	^newCollection

methods.name: do:without:
methods.sourceCode: do: aBlock without: anItem 	"Enumerate all elements in the receiver. 	Execute aBlock for those elements that are not equal to the given item"	^ self do: [:each | anItem = each ifFalse: [aBlock value: each]]

methods.name: arcTan
methods.sourceCode: arcTan	^self collect: [:each | each arcTan]

methods.name: detectSum:
methods.sourceCode: detectSum: aBlock	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument. 	Return the sum of the answers."	| sum |	self deprecated: 'Use #sum: instead'.	sum := 0.	self do: [:each | 		sum := (aBlock value: each) + sum].  	^ sum

methods.name: sqrt
methods.sourceCode: sqrt	^ self collect: [:each | each sqrt]

methods.name: printElementsOn:
methods.sourceCode: printElementsOn: aStream	"The original code used #skip:, but some streams do not support that,	 and we don't really need it."	aStream nextPut: $(.	self do: [:element | aStream print: element] separatedBy: [aStream space].	aStream nextPut: $)

methods.name: printOn:delimiter:last:
methods.sourceCode: printOn: aStream delimiter: delimString last: lastDelimString	"Print elements on a stream separated	with a delimiter between all the elements and with	a special one before the last like: 'a, b and c'	Note: Feel free to improve the code to detect the last element."	| n sz |	n := 1.	sz := self size.	self do: [:elem |		n := n + 1.		aStream print: elem]	separatedBy: [		n = sz			ifTrue: [aStream print: lastDelimString]			ifFalse: [aStream print: delimString]]

methods.name: flatCollectAsSet:
methods.sourceCode: flatCollectAsSet: aBlock	"Evaluate aBlock for each of the receiver's elements and answer the	list of all resulting values flatten one level. Assumes that aBlock returns some kind	of collection for each element. Equivalent to the lisp's mapcan"		^ self flatCollect: aBlock as: Set

methods.name: flattenOn:
methods.sourceCode: flattenOn: aStream	self do: [ :each | each flattenOn: aStream ]

methods.name: includesAllOf:
methods.sourceCode: includesAllOf: aCollection 	self		deprecated: 'Please use #includesAll: instead'		transformWith: '`@receiver includesAllOf: `@statements' -> '`@receiver includesAll: `@statements'.		^ self includesAll: aCollection

methods.name: asSet
methods.sourceCode: asSet	"Answer a Set whose elements are the unique elements of the receiver."	^ Set withAll: self

methods.name: addToMetacelloRepositories:
methods.sourceCode: addToMetacelloRepositories: aMetacelloRepositoriesSpec	self do: [:each | each addToMetacelloRepositories: aMetacelloRepositoriesSpec ]

methods.name: resolvePackageSpecsNamedForMetacelloMCVersion:visited:ifAbsent:
methods.sourceCode: resolvePackageSpecsNamedForMetacelloMCVersion: aMetacelloMCVersion visited: visited ifAbsent: aBlock    ^ aMetacelloMCVersion        allPackagesForSpecs: (self collect: [ :ea | aMetacelloMCVersion packageNamed: ea ifAbsent: aBlock ])        visited: visited

methods.name: copyEmpty
methods.sourceCode: copyEmpty	^ self species new

methods.name: sumNumbers
methods.sourceCode: sumNumbers	"This is implemented using a variant of the normal inject:into: pattern	that is specific to handling numbers. The receiver should include only numbers.		Different from the sum implementation, the default value is zero. While sum is 	more general, sumNumbers is meant to support the most often encountered use case of	dealing with numbers."	^ self 		inject: 0 		into: [ :sum :each |  sum + each ]

methods.name: ifNotEmpty:ifEmpty:
methods.sourceCode: ifNotEmpty: notEmptyBlock ifEmpty: emptyBlock	"Evaluate emptyBlock if I'm empty, notEmptyBlock otherwise	 If the notEmptyBlock has an argument, eval with the receiver as its argument"	^ self isEmpty		ifTrue: [ emptyBlock value ]		ifFalse: [ notEmptyBlock cull: self ]

methods.name: size
methods.sourceCode: size	"Answer how many elements the receiver contains."	| tally |	tally := 0.	self do: [:each | tally := tally + 1].	^ tally

methods.name: addedToZnUrl:
methods.sourceCode: addedToZnUrl: url 	^ url withPathSegments: self

methods.name: ln
methods.sourceCode: ln	^self collect: [:each | each ln]

methods.name: asOrderedDictionary
methods.sourceCode: asOrderedDictionary	^ self as: OrderedDictionary

methods.name: inject:into:
methods.sourceCode: inject: thisValue into: binaryBlock 	"Accumulate a running value associated with evaluating the argument, binaryBlock, with the current value of the argument, thisValue, and the receiver as block arguments."		"( #(1 2 3) inject: 0 into: [ :sum :each | sum + each ] ) >>> 6"	| nextValue |	nextValue := thisValue.	self do: [:each | nextValue := binaryBlock value: nextValue value: each].	^nextValue

methods.name: capacity
methods.sourceCode: capacity	"Answer the current capacity of the receiver."	^ self size

methods.name: squared
methods.sourceCode: squared	^ self collect: [:each | each * each]

methods.name: reduce:
methods.sourceCode: reduce: aBlock	"Fold the result of the receiver into aBlock. The argument aBlock must take two or more arguments. It applies the argument, binaryBlock cumulatively to the elements of the receiver. For sequenceable collections the elements will be used in order, for unordered collections the order is unspecified."	"( #(1 2 3) asSet reduce: [ :a :b | a + b ] ) >>> 1 + 2 + 3"	"( #(1 2 3 4 5) asSet reduce: [ :a :b :c | a + b + c ] ) >>> 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5"			^self asOrderedCollection reduce: aBlock

methods.name: removeAll:
methods.sourceCode: removeAll: aCollection 	"Remove each element of aCollection from the receiver. If successful for 	each, answer aCollection. Otherwise create an error notification.	ArrayedCollections cannot respond to this message."	aCollection == self ifTrue: [^self removeAll].	aCollection do: [:each | self remove: each].	^ aCollection

methods.name: gtInspectorItemsIn:
methods.sourceCode: gtInspectorItemsIn: composite	<gtInspectorPresentationOrder: 0>	^ composite fastList		title: 'Items';		display: [ "The FastTable renderer needs to access elements by index so we transform			the collection to an OrderedCollection. Subclasses can override the #display			block to provide a different behaviour. The previous renderer had this behaviour			implemented in the renderer." self asOrderedCollection ];		beMultiple;		format: [ :each | GTObjectPrinter asTruncatedTextFrom: each ];		send: [ :result | 			"withSmalltalkSearch;			showOnly: 50;		helpMessage: 'Quick selection field. Given your INPUT, it executes: self select: [:each | INPUT ]'."			result				ifNotNil: [ result size = 1						ifTrue: [ result anyOne ]						ifFalse: [ self species withAll: result ] ] ]

methods.name: doWithIndex:
methods.sourceCode: doWithIndex: elementAndIndexBlock	"Use the new version with consistent naming		Example of use:	(#('hello' 'world' 'bonjour') doWithIndex: [ :element :index |  ])	"	^ self withIndexDo: elementAndIndexBlock

methods.name: collectAll:
methods.sourceCode: collectAll: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument.  	Collect all the resulting values into a collection like the receiver. Answer  	the new collection."	| newCollection |	newCollection := self species new.	self do: [:each | newCollection addAll: (aBlock value: each)].	^ newCollection

methods.name: atRandom
methods.sourceCode: atRandom	"Answer a random element of the receiver.  Uses a shared random 	number generator owned by class Collection.  If you use this a lot, 	define your own instance of Random and use #atRandom:.  Causes 	an error if self has no elements."	^ self atRandom: SharedRandom globalGenerator."Examples:	#('one' 'or' 'the' 'other') atRandom	(1 to: 10) atRandom	'Just pick one of these letters at random' atRandom	#(3 7 4 9 21) asSet atRandom		(just to show it also works for Sets)"

methods.name: sorted
methods.sourceCode: sorted	"Return a new sequenceable collection which contains the same elements as self but its elements are sorted"		^self asArray sorted

methods.name: detect:ifFound:
methods.sourceCode: detect: aBlock ifFound: foundBlock	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument.  	If some element evaluates aBlock to true, then cull this element into 	foundBlock. 	If no element matches the criteria then do nothing.	Always returns self to avoid misuse and a potential isNil check on the sender."	"(#(1 2) detect: [ :each | each even ] ifFound: [ ^'yay!' ]) >>> 'yay'"	"(#(1 3) detect: [ :each | each even ] ifFound: [ ^'yay!' ]) >>> #(1 3)"	self		detect: aBlock		ifFound: foundBlock		ifNone: [ 			"Do nothing on purpose"			 ]

methods.name: rounded
methods.sourceCode: rounded	^ self collect: [:a | a rounded]

methods.name: anyOne
methods.sourceCode: anyOne	"Answer a representative sample of the receiver. It raises an error when the collection is empty. This method can be helpful when needing to preinfer the nature of the contents of semi-homogeneous collections."	"#(1 2 3) anyOne >>> 1"	"	([#() anyOne] on: SubscriptOutOfBounds do: [ :ex | 'whatever' ]) >>> 'whatever'	"		self emptyCheck.	self do: [:each | ^ each]

methods.name: add:
methods.sourceCode: add: newObject 	"Include newObject as one of the receiver's elements. Answer newObject. 	ArrayedCollections cannot respond to this message."	self subclassResponsibility
, aCollection	"Concatenate the receiver with the argument."	"#(1 2 3) , #(4 5 6) >>> #(1 2 3 4 5 6)"		^self copy addAll: aCollection; yourself

methods.name: stdev
methods.sourceCode: stdev	| avg sample sum |	"In statistics, the standard deviation is a measure that is used to quantify the amount of variation or dispersion of a set of data values.	For details about implementation see comment in self sum."	avg := self average.	sample := self anyOne.	sum := self inject: sample into: [ :accum :each | accum + (each - avg) squared ].	sum := sum - sample.	^ (sum / (self size - 1)) sqrt

methods.name: asSortedCollection:
methods.sourceCode: asSortedCollection: aSortBlock 	"Answer a SortedCollection whose elements are the elements of the receiver. The sort order is defined by the argument, aSortBlock. Note that it is better to use #sorted: if you don't really need a SortedCollection, but a sorted collection!!"	| aSortedCollection |	aSortedCollection := SortedCollection new: self size.	aSortedCollection sortBlock: aSortBlock.	aSortedCollection addAll: self.	^ aSortedCollection

methods.name: detect:ifFound:ifNone:
methods.sourceCode: detect: aBlock ifFound: foundBlock ifNone: exceptionBlock	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument.  	If some element evaluates aBlock to true, then cull this element into 	foundBlock and answer the result of this evaluation. 	If none evaluate to true, then evaluate exceptionBlock."	self		do: [ :each | 			(aBlock value: each)				ifTrue: [ ^ foundBlock cull: each ] ].	^ exceptionBlock value

methods.name: allSatisfy:
methods.sourceCode: allSatisfy: aBlock	"Evaluate aBlock with the elements of the receiver.	If aBlock returns false for any element return false.	Otherwise return true."	"#(1 2) allSatisfy: [ :each | each even ] >>> false"	"#(2 4) allSatisfy: [ :each | each even ] >>> true"	self do: [:each | (aBlock value: each) ifFalse: [^ false]].	^ true

methods.name: asSLVMMessagePackSerializableObject
methods.sourceCode: asSLVMMessagePackSerializableObject	^ self asArray

methods.name: removeAll
methods.sourceCode: removeAll	"Remove each element from the receiver and leave it empty.	ArrayedCollections cannot respond to this message.	There are two good reasons why a subclass should override this message:	1) the subclass does not support being modified while being iterated	2) the subclass provides a much faster way than iterating through each element"	self do: [:each | self remove: each].

methods.name: setRequiresInMetacelloPackage:
methods.sourceCode: setRequiresInMetacelloPackage: aMetacelloPackageSpec	aMetacelloPackageSpec setRequires: self asArray.

methods.name: sumNumbers:
methods.sourceCode: sumNumbers: aBlock	"This is implemented using a variant of the normal inject:into: pattern	that is specific to handling numbers. aBlock is expected to return a number	for every element in the collection.		Different from the sum: implementation, the default value is zero. While sum: is 	more general, sumNumbers: is meant to support the most often encountered use case of	dealing with numbers."	^ self 		inject: 0 		into: [ :sum :each |  sum + (aBlock value: each) ]

methods.name: do:displayingProgress:every:
methods.sourceCode: do: aBlock displayingProgress: aStringOrBlock every: msecs	"Enumerate aBlock displaying progress information. 	 If the argument is a string, use a static label for the process.	 If the argument is a block, evaluate it with the element to retrieve the label. 	 The msecs argument ensures that updates happen at most every msecs.       Example:               Smalltalk allClasses                       do:[:aClass| (Delay forMilliseconds: 1) wait]                       displayingProgress:[:aClass| 'Processing ', aClass name]                       every: 0."	| size labelBlock count oldLabel lastUpdate |	self isEmpty ifTrue: [ ^ self ].	oldLabel := nil.	count := lastUpdate := 0.	size := self size.	'' displayProgressFrom: 0 to: size during: [:bar |		labelBlock := aStringOrBlock isString			ifTrue: [				bar label: aStringOrBlock.				[ :dummyItem | aStringOrBlock] ]			ifFalse: [ aStringOrBlock ].		self do: [ :each | | newLabel |			"Special handling for first and last element"			(count = 0 or: [ count + 1 = size or: [(Time millisecondsSince: lastUpdate) >= msecs]]) 				ifTrue: [ 					bar current: count.					oldLabel = (newLabel := (labelBlock cull: each) ifNil: [oldLabel]) 						ifFalse: [							bar label: newLabel.							oldLabel := newLabel ].				lastUpdate := Time millisecondClockValue ].			aBlock value: each.			count := count + 1 ] ]

methods.name: contents
methods.sourceCode: contents	^ self

methods.name: addIfNotPresent:
methods.sourceCode: addIfNotPresent: anObject	"Include anObject as one of the receiver's elements, but only if there	is no such element already. Anwser anObject."	(self includes: anObject) ifFalse: [self add: anObject].	^ anObject

methods.name: asSequenceParser
methods.sourceCode: asSequenceParser	^ PPSequenceParser withAll: (self collect: [ :each | each asParser ])

methods.name: fold:
methods.sourceCode: fold: binaryBlock	"Evaluate the block with the first two elements of the receiver, then with the result of the first evaluation and the next element, and so on.  Answer the result of the final evaluation. If the receiver is empty, raise an error. If the receiver has a single element, answer that element."	"( #('if' 'it' 'is' 'to' 'be' 'it' 'is' 'up' 'to' 'me') fold: [:a :b | a, ' ', b] ) >>> 'if it is to be it is up to me'"	^self reduce: binaryBlock

methods.name: anySatisfy:
methods.sourceCode: anySatisfy: aBlock	"Evaluate aBlock with the elements of the receiver.	If aBlock returns true for any element return true.	Otherwise return false."	"#(1 3) anySatisfy: [ :each | each even ] >>> false"	"#(1 2) anySatisfy: [ :each | each even ] >>> true"	self do: [:each | (aBlock value: each) ifTrue: [^ true]].	^ false

methods.name: selectEveryFirst
methods.sourceCode: selectEveryFirst	"#(1 2 3 4) selectEveryFirst asArray 	>>> #(1 3)	"	^ self selectEvery: [ :i | (i+1 \\ 2) = 0 ]

methods.name: findFirstInByteString:startingAt:
methods.sourceCode: findFirstInByteString: aByteString startingAt: start	"Find the index of first character starting at start in aByteString that is included in the receiver.	Default is to use a naive algorithm.	Subclasses might want to implement a more efficient scheme"	start to: aByteString size do:		[:index |		(self includes: (aByteString at: index)) ifTrue: [^ index]].	^ 0

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.sourceCode: isEmpty	"Answer whether the receiver contains any elements."	^self size = 0

methods.name: asParser
methods.sourceCode: asParser    	"Create a range of characters between start and stop."	(self allSatisfy: [ :e | e isCharacter ]) ifTrue: [ 		| charSet |		charSet := PPCharSetPredicate on: [ :char | self includes: char ] .     	^ PPPredicateObjectParser on: charSet message: 'One of these charactes expected: ', self printString.	].	^ super asParser	"		($a to:$f) asParser parse:'a'		($a to:$f) asParser parse:'g'	"

methods.name: arcSin
methods.sourceCode: arcSin	^self collect: [:each | each arcSin]

methods.name: emptyCheck
methods.sourceCode: emptyCheck	self isEmpty ifTrue: [self errorEmptyCollection]

methods.name: occurrencesOf:
methods.sourceCode: occurrencesOf: anObject 	"Answer how many of the receiver's elements are equal to anObject."	| tally |	tally := 0.	self do: [:each | anObject = each ifTrue: [tally := tally + 1]].	^tally

methods.name: union:
methods.sourceCode: union: aCollection	"Answer the set theoretic union of two collections."	"(#(1 2 3) union: #(4 5 6 2)) >>> #(1 2 3 4 5 6)"		| set |	set := self asSet addAll: aCollection; yourself.	^ self species withAll: set asArray

methods.name: unzip
methods.sourceCode: unzip	"Given a collection returns in one pass two collections containing each odd and even elements in respective subcollections"	"	#(1 2 3 4) unzip first asArray 	>>> #(1 3)	#(1 2 3 4) unzip second asArray 	>>> #(2 4)	"		| odd even s |	s := self size // 2.	odd := OrderedCollection new: s.	even := OrderedCollection new: s.	1 		to: self size 		do: [ :i | (i \\ 2) = 0							ifTrue: [ even add: (self at: i) ]						ifFalse: [ odd add: (self at: i) ] ].	^ { odd . even }

methods.name: reject:
methods.sourceCode: reject: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument. Collect into a new collection like the receiver only those elements for which aBlock evaluates to false. Answer the new collection."	"#(1 2 3 4 5) reject: #even >>>  #(1 3 5)"	^ self select: [ :element | (aBlock value: element) == false ]
| aCollection	"Return all the elements that appear in self or in aCollection"	"'abc' | 'cbe' >>> 'bcea'"		^ self union: aCollection

methods.sourceCode: select: selectBlock thenCollect: collectBlock	"Utility method to improve readability."	^ (self select: selectBlock) collect: collectBlock
& aCollection	"#(1 2 3 4) & #(1 2 4 6 7) >>> #(1 2 4)"		^ self intersection: aCollection

methods.name: detectMin:
methods.sourceCode: detectMin: aBlock	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument. 	Answer the element for which aBlock evaluates to the lowest number.	If collection empty, return nil.		Example of use:	({ 2@3 . -4@6 . 10@ -3 } detectMin: [ :p | p x ]) >>> (-4@6)	({ 2@3 . -4@6 . 10@ -3 } detectMin: [ :p | p y ]) >>> (10@ -3)	"	| minElement minValue |	self do: [:each | | val | 		minValue == nil			ifFalse: [				(val := aBlock value: each) < minValue ifTrue: [					minElement := each.					minValue := val]]			ifTrue: ["first element"				minElement := each.				minValue := aBlock value: each].				"Note that there is no way to get the first element that works 				for all kinds of Collections.  Must test every one."].	^ minElement

methods.name: selectEvery:
methods.sourceCode: selectEvery: aBlock	"Select elements of the receiver whose index satisfy the argument. Look at selectEveryFirst and selectEverySecond for examples."		| res |	res := OrderedCollection new.	1 to: self size do: [ :i | (aBlock value: i) 											ifTrue: [res add: (self at: i) ]].	^ res

methods.name: sum:ifEmpty:
methods.sourceCode: sum: aBlock ifEmpty: anEmptySumBlock	"This is implemented using a variant of the normal inject:into: pattern. 	The reason for this is that it is not known whether we're in the normal 	number line, i.e. whether 0 is a good initial value for the sum. 	Consider a collection of measurement objects, 0 would be the unitless 	value and would not be appropriate to add with the unit-ed objects."	| sum sample |		^ self		ifNotEmpty: [ 			sample := aBlock value: self anyOne.			sum := self inject: sample into: [ :previousValue :each |				previousValue + (aBlock value: each) ].			sum - sample ]		ifEmpty: anEmptySumBlock.

methods.name: range
methods.sourceCode: range	"returns the difference between the max and min element, their positions notwithstanding"	"#( 1 51 10 ) range >>> 50"	^ self max - self min

methods.name: associationsDo:
methods.sourceCode: associationsDo: aBlock	"Evaluate aBlock for each of the receiver's elements (key/value 	associations).  If any non-association is within, the error is not caught now,	but later, when a key or value message is sent to it."	self do: aBlock

methods.name: gtInspectorHash
methods.sourceCode: gtInspectorHash	^ super gtInspectorHash bitXor: self size hash

methods.name: flatCollect:as:
methods.sourceCode: flatCollect: aBlock as: aCollectionClass	"Evaluate aBlock for each of the receiver's elements and answer the	list of all resulting values flatten one level. Assumes that aBlock returns some kind	of collection for each element. Equivalent to the lisp's mapcan"	| col |	col := OrderedCollection new: self size.	self do: [ :each | col addAll: (aBlock value: each) ].	^ aCollectionClass withAll: col

methods.name: remove:
methods.sourceCode: remove: oldObject 	"Remove oldObject from the receiver's elements. Answer oldObject 	unless no element is equal to oldObject, in which case, raise an error.	ArrayedCollections cannot respond to this message."	^ self remove: oldObject ifAbsent: [self errorNotFound: oldObject]

methods.name: asBag

methods.name: do:displayingProgress:
methods.sourceCode: do: aBlock displayingProgress: aStringOrBlock	"Enumerate aBlock displaying progress information.  	 If the argument is a string, use a static label for the process. 	 If the argument is a block, evaluate it with the element to retrieve the label.			Smalltalk allClasses 			do:[:aClass| (Delay forMilliseconds: 1) wait]			displayingProgress: 'Processing...'.		Smalltalk allClasses 			do:[:aClass| (Delay forMilliseconds: 1) wait]			displayingProgress:[:aClass| 'Processing ', aClass name].	"	^self do: aBlock displayingProgress: aStringOrBlock every: 20
/ arg	^ arg adaptToCollection: self andSend: #/

methods.name: ifNotEmpty:
methods.sourceCode: ifNotEmpty: aBlock	"Evaluate the given block with the receiver as argument, answering its value    unless the receiver is empty, in which case answer the receiver."	^ self isEmpty		ifTrue: [ self ]		ifFalse: [ aBlock cull: self ]

methods.name: ifEmpty:
methods.sourceCode: ifEmpty: aBlock	"Evaluate the given block, answering its value if the receiver is empty, otherwise answer the receiver."	"Note that the fact that this method returns its receiver in case the receiver is not empty allows one to write expressions like the following ones: self classifyMethodAs: (myProtocol ifEmpty: ['As yet unclassified'])"	^ self isEmpty		ifTrue: [ aBlock value ]		ifFalse: [ self ]

methods.name: adaptToNumber:andSend:
methods.sourceCode: adaptToNumber: rcvr andSend: selector	"If I am involved in arithmetic with a scalar, return a Collection of	the results of each element combined with the scalar in that expression."	^ self collect: [:element | rcvr perform: selector with: element]

methods.name: collect:into:
methods.sourceCode: collect: aBlock into: aCollection	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument.  	Collect the resulting values into aCollection. Answer aCollection."	^aCollection fillFrom: self with: aBlock

methods.name: ceiling
methods.sourceCode: ceiling	^ self collect: [:a | a ceiling]

methods.name: asSortedCollection
methods.sourceCode: asSortedCollection	"Answer a SortedCollection whose elements are the elements of the receiver. The sort order is the default less than or equal. Note that you should use #sorted: if you don't really need a SortedCollection, but a sorted collection."	^ self as: SortedCollection

methods.name: collect:thenReject:
methods.sourceCode: collect: collectBlock thenReject: selectBlock	"Utility method to improve readability."	^ (self collect: collectBlock) reject: selectBlock

methods.name: count:
methods.sourceCode: count: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument.  	Answer the number of elements that answered true."	"#(1 2 3 4) count: [ :each | each even ] >>> true"	| sum |	sum := 0.	self do: [:each | (aBlock value: each) ifTrue: [sum := sum + 1]].	^ sum
\\ arg	^ arg adaptToCollection: self andSend: #\\

methods.name: asKeyCombination
methods.sourceCode: asKeyCombination	| shortcut |	self size = 1 ifTrue: [ ^self first asKeyCombination ].	shortcut := KMKeyCombinationSequence new.	self do: [ :each | shortcut addShortcut: each asKeyCombination ].	^shortcut.

methods.name: copyWithoutAll:
methods.sourceCode: copyWithoutAll: aCollection	"Answer a copy of the receiver that does not contain any elements 	equal to those in aCollection."	^ self reject: [:each | aCollection includes: each]

methods.name: exp
methods.sourceCode: exp	^self collect: [:each | each exp]

methods.name: sum:
methods.sourceCode: sum: aBlock	"This is implemented using a variant of the normal inject:into: pattern. 	The reason for this is that it is not known whether we're in the normal 	number line, i.e. whether 0 is a good initial value for the sum. 	Consider a collection of measurement objects, 0 would be the unitless 	value and would not be appropriate to add with the unit-ed objects."	^ self sum: aBlock ifEmpty: [ 0 ]

methods.name: includes:
methods.sourceCode: includes: anObject 	"Answer whether anObject is one of the receiver's elements."	^ self anySatisfy: [:each | each = anObject]

methods.name: intersection:
methods.sourceCode: intersection: aCollection	"Answer the set theoretic intersection of two collections."	"(#(1 2 3 4) intersection: #(3 4 5)) >>> #(3 4)"	"(#(1 2 3 4) intersection: #()) >>> #()"	"(#() intersection: #(1 2 3 4)) >>> #()"	^ self species withAll: (self asSet intersection: aCollection) asArray

methods.name: collect:
methods.sourceCode: collect: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument.  	Collect the resulting values into a collection like the receiver. Answer  	the new collection."	| newCollection |	newCollection := self species new.	self do: [:each | newCollection add: (aBlock value: each)].	^ newCollection

methods.name: removeAllSuchThat:
methods.sourceCode: removeAllSuchThat: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock for each element and remove all that elements from	the receiver for that aBlock evaluates to true.  Use a copy to enumerate 	collections whose order changes when an element is removed (i.e. Sets)."	self copy do: [:each | (aBlock value: each) ifTrue: [self remove: each]]

methods.name: asArray
methods.sourceCode: asArray	"Answer an Array whose elements are the elements of the receiver.	Implementation note: Cannot use ''Array withAll: self'' as that only	works for SequenceableCollections which support the replacement 	primitive."	| newArray index |	newArray := Array new: self size.	index := 0.	self do: [:each | newArray at: (index := index + 1) put: each].	^ newArray

methods.name: groupedBy:
methods.sourceCode: groupedBy: aBlock	"Answer a dictionary whose keys are the result of evaluating aBlock for all my elements, and the value for each key is the selection of my elements that evaluated to that key. Uses species.		Example of use:	(#(1 2 3 4 5) groupedBy: [ :v | v odd ]) asString >>> 'an OrderedDictionary(true->#(1 3 5) false->#(2 4))'	"				| groups |	groups := OrderedDictionary new.	self do: [ :each |		(groups at: (aBlock value: each) ifAbsentPut: [ OrderedCollection new ]) add: each ].	self species ~~ OrderedCollection ifTrue: [		groups associationsDo: [ :association |			association value: (self species withAll: association value) ]].	^ groups

methods.name: ifEmpty:ifNotEmpty:
methods.sourceCode: ifEmpty: emptyBlock ifNotEmpty: notEmptyBlock	"Evaluate emptyBlock if I'm empty, notEmptyBlock otherwise"	"If the notEmptyBlock has an argument, eval with the receiver as its argument"	^ self isEmpty		ifTrue: [ emptyBlock value ]		ifFalse: [ notEmptyBlock cull: self ]

methods.name: spotterItemsFor:
methods.sourceCode: spotterItemsFor: aStep	<spotterOrder: 10>	| processor |	(self isEmpty or: [ self size > self gtCollectionSizeThreshold ]) ifTrue: [ ^ self ].	processor := aStep previousProcessorFrom: self.	^ aStep listProcessor		title: processor title;		candidatesLimit: 100;		items: [ self collect: [ :each | each asSpotterCandidateLink value] as: OrderedCollection ];		itemName: processor itemName;		itemIcon: processor itemIcon;		actLogic: processor actLogic; 		filter: processor filter gtListFilter;		wantsToDisplayOnEmptyQuery: true

methods.name: select:thenDo:
methods.sourceCode: select: selectBlock thenDo: doBlock    "Utility method to improve readability.	Do not create the intermediate collection."    self do: [: each |        ( selectBlock value: each ) 			ifTrue: [ doBlock value: each ]    ].

methods.name: selectEverySecond
methods.sourceCode: selectEverySecond	"#(1 2 3 4) selectEverySecond asArray 	>>> #(2 4)	"	^ self selectEvery: [ :i | i \\ 2 = 0 ]

methods.name: asGPoint
methods.sourceCode: asGPoint	^ GPoint withCollection: self

methods.name: isEmptyOrNil
methods.sourceCode: isEmptyOrNil	"Answer whether the receiver contains any elements, or is nil.  Useful in numerous situations where one wishes the same reaction to an empty collection or to nil"	^ self isEmpty

methods.name: maxValue:
methods.sourceCode: maxValue: aBlock	^ self inject: (aBlock value: self anyOne) into: [ :max :each | max max: (aBlock value: each) ]

methods.name: atRandom:
methods.sourceCode: atRandom: aGenerator	"Answer a random element of the receiver. Uses aGenerator whichshould be kept by the user in a variable and used every time. Usethis instead of #atRandom for better uniformity of random numbers because 	only you use the generator. Causes an error if self has no elements."	| rand |	self emptyCheck.	rand := aGenerator nextInteger: self size.	self withIndexDo: [:each :index | index = rand ifTrue: [^each]]

methods.name: identityIncludes:
methods.sourceCode: identityIncludes: anObject 	"Answer whether anObject is one of the receiver's elements."	self do: [:each | anObject == each ifTrue: [^true]].	^false

methods.name: neoJsonOn:
methods.sourceCode: neoJsonOn: neoJSONWriter	neoJSONWriter writeList: self

methods.name: asWBTVarSubstitution
methods.sourceCode: asWBTVarSubstitution	self ifEmpty: [ ^ '' ].		^ ByteString streamContents: [ :out |		self doWithIndex: [ :each :index |			index > 1 ifTrue: [ out space ].			out nextPutAll: each asWBTVarSubstitution		]	]

methods.name: copyWithDependent:
methods.sourceCode: copyWithDependent: newElement	"Answer a new collection with newElement added (as last	element if sequenceable)."	^self copyWith: newElement

methods.name: withIndexDo:
methods.sourceCode: withIndexDo: elementAndIndexBlock	"Just like do: except that the iteration index supplies the second argument to the block"	"Support collection enumeration with a counter, even though not ordered"	| index |	index := 0.	self do: [:item | elementAndIndexBlock value: item value: (index := index+1)]

methods.name: addAssignToFloatArray:
methods.sourceCode: addAssignToFloatArray: aFloatArray	1 to: aFloatArray size do: [ :i | aFloatArray at: i put: (aFloatArray at: i) + (self at: i) ].	^ aFloatArray

methods.name: truncated
methods.sourceCode: truncated	^ self collect: [:a | a truncated]

methods.name: setImportInVersionSpec:
methods.sourceCode: setImportInVersionSpec: aMetacelloVersionSpec  aMetacelloVersionSpec setImport: self asArray

methods.name: asByteArray
methods.sourceCode: asByteArray	"Answer a ByteArray whose elements are the elements of the receiver.	Implementation note: Cannot use ''ByteArray withAll: self'' as that only	works for SequenceableCollections which support the replacement 	primitive."	| array index |	array := ByteArray new: self size.	index := 0.	self do: [:each | array at: (index := index + 1) put: each].	^ array

methods.name: write:
methods.sourceCode: write: anObject	self		deprecated: 'Please use #add: instead'		transformWith: '`@receiver write: `@statements1' 						-> '`@receiver add: `@statements1'.	^ self add: anObject

methods.name: add:withOccurrences:
methods.sourceCode: add: newObject withOccurrences: anInteger	"Add newObject anInteger times to the receiver. Answer newObject."	anInteger timesRepeat: [self add: newObject].	^ newObject

methods.name: contains:
methods.sourceCode: contains: aBlock	"For compatibility, please use #anySatisfy: instead!"	^self anySatisfy: aBlock
* arg	^ arg adaptToCollection: self andSend: #*

methods.name: log
methods.sourceCode: log	^ self collect: [:each | each log]

methods.name: setForDo:withInMetacelloConfig:
methods.sourceCode: setForDo: aBlock withInMetacelloConfig: aMetacelloConstructore    aMetacelloConstructore setFor: self do: aBlock

methods.name: asEmailHeaderString
methods.sourceCode: asEmailHeaderString	^ String streamContents: [ :str | 			self				do: [ :e | str nextPutAll: e asEmailHeaderString ]				separatedBy: [ str nextPutAll: ', ' ] ]

methods.name: gtDisplayOn:
methods.sourceCode: gtDisplayOn: stream	self printNameOn: stream.	stream		space;		nextPut: $[;		print: self size;		nextPutAll: (' item' asPluralBasedOn: self size);		nextPut: $];		space.	self size <= self gtCollectionSizeThreshold 		ifTrue: [ self printElementsOn: stream ]

methods.name: adaptToPoint:andSend:
methods.sourceCode: adaptToPoint: rcvr andSend: selector	"If I am involved in arithmetic with a scalar, return a Collection of	the results of each element combined with the scalar in that expression."	^ self collect: [:element | rcvr perform: selector with: element]

methods.name: sorted:
methods.sourceCode: sorted: aSortBlockOrNil	"Return a new sequenceable collection which contains the same elements as self but its elements are sorted by aSortBlockOrNil. The block should take two arguments and return true if the first element should preceed the second one. If aSortBlock is nil then <= is used for comparison."		^self asArray sort: aSortBlockOrNil

methods.name: groupedBy:having:
methods.sourceCode: groupedBy: aBlock having: aSelectionBlock	"Like in SQL operation - Split the recievers contents into collections of 	elements for which keyBlock returns the same results, and return those 	collections allowed by selectBlock."	^ (self groupedBy: aBlock) select: aSelectionBlock

methods.name: hash
methods.sourceCode: hash	"Answer an integer hash value for the receiver such that,	  -- the hash value of an unchanged object is constant over time, and	  -- two equal objects have equal hash values"	| hash |	hash := self species hash.	self size <= 10 ifTrue:		[self do: [:elem | hash := hash bitXor: elem hash]].	^hash bitXor: self size hash

methods.name: reciprocal
methods.sourceCode: reciprocal	"Return the reciever full of reciprocated elements"	"#(1 11 0.5) reciprocal >>> {1 . 1/11 . 2.0}"	^ self collect: [:a | a reciprocal]

methods.name: mergeIntoMetacelloRepositories:
methods.sourceCode: mergeIntoMetacelloRepositories: aMetacelloRepositoriesSpec	self do: [:each | each mergeIntoMetacelloRepositories: aMetacelloRepositoriesSpec ]

methods.name: detect:
methods.sourceCode: detect: aBlock 	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument. 	Answer the first element for which aBlock evaluates to true."	"(#(1 2 3 4) detect: [ :each | each even ]) >>> 2"	^ self detect: aBlock ifNone: [self errorNotFound: aBlock]

methods.name: isSequenceable
methods.sourceCode: isSequenceable	^ false

methods.name: errorNotFound:
methods.sourceCode: errorNotFound: anObject	"Raise a NotFound exception."	NotFound signalFor: anObject

methods.name: average
methods.sourceCode: average	"Calculate the average of a collection, return a CollectionIsEmpty exception if the collection is empty. Look averageIfEmpty: aBlock"		" #(2 6 7) average   	>>> 5 "		" #(3 5 7 7) average 	>>> (11/2) "	^ self sum / self size
+ arg	^ arg adaptToCollection: self andSend: #+

methods.name: abs
methods.sourceCode: abs	"Absolute value of all elements in the collection"	^ self collect: [:a | a abs]

methods.name: includesSubstringAnywhere:
methods.sourceCode: includesSubstringAnywhere: testString	"Answer whether the receiver includes, anywhere in its nested structure, a string that has testString as a substring"	self do:		[:element |			(element isString)				ifTrue:					[(element includesSubstring: testString) ifTrue: [^ true]].			(element isCollection)				ifTrue:					[(element includesSubstringAnywhere: testString) ifTrue: [^ true]]].	^ false"#(first (second third) ((allSentMessages ('Elvis' includes:)))) includesSubstringAnywhere:  'lvi'"
\ aCollection	"Return all the elements in self that are not in aCollection"	"'abc' \ 'cbe' >>> 'a'."		^ self difference: aCollection

methods.name: setForVersion:withInMetacelloConfig:
methods.sourceCode: setForVersion: aString withInMetacelloConfig: aMetacelloConstructore    aMetacelloConstructore setFor: self version: aString

methods.name: asMetacelloAttributeList
methods.sourceCode: asMetacelloAttributeList    ^ self

methods.name: detectMax:
methods.sourceCode: detectMax: aBlock	"Evaluate aBlock with each of the receiver's elements as the argument. 	Answer the element for which aBlock evaluates to the highest magnitude.	If collection empty, return nil.  This method might also be called elect:."	| maxElement maxValue |	self do: [:each | | val | 		maxValue == nil			ifFalse: [				(val := aBlock value: each) > maxValue ifTrue: [					maxElement := each.					maxValue := val]]			ifTrue: ["first element"				maxElement := each.				maxValue := aBlock value: each].				"Note that there is no way to get the first element that works 				for all kinds of Collections.  Must test every one."].	^ maxElement

methods.name: median
methods.sourceCode: median	"Return the middle element, or as close as we can get.		Example of use:	{1 . 2 . 3 . 4 . 5} median >>> 3	{1 . 2 . 4 . 5} median >>> 3	{1 . 2 . 5 . 5} median >>> (7/2)	"		^ self asSortedCollection median
-- other	^ self , other

methods.name: setLoadsInMetacelloProject:
methods.sourceCode: setLoadsInMetacelloProject: aMetacelloPackageSpec	aMetacelloPackageSpec setLoads: self asArray.

methods.name: includesAnyOf:
methods.sourceCode: includesAnyOf: aCollection 		self flag: 'use includesAny: instead'.		^ self includesAny: aCollection.

methods.name: asIdentitySet
methods.sourceCode: asIdentitySet	^(IdentitySet new: self size) addAll: self; yourself

methods.name: with:with:with:with:with:with:
methods.sourceCode: with: firstObject with: secondObject with: thirdObject with: fourthObject with: fifthObject with: sixthObject	"Answer an instance of me, containing the six arguments as the elements."	^ self new		add: firstObject;		add: secondObject;		add: thirdObject;		add: fourthObject;		add: fifthObject;		add: sixthObject;		yourself

methods.name: with:with:with:with:
methods.sourceCode: with: firstObject with: secondObject with: thirdObject with: fourthObject 	"Answer an instance of me, containing the four arguments as the elements."	^ self new		add: firstObject;		add: secondObject;		add: thirdObject;		add: fourthObject;		yourself

methods.name: fromSton:
methods.sourceCode: fromSton: stonReader	"For collections we chose to instanciate based a list of elements using #add:	This is not the best or most correct solution for all subclasses though,	so some will revert to standard object behavior or chose another solution."		| collection |	collection := self new.	stonReader parseListDo: [ :each |		collection add: each ].	^ collection

methods.name: systemIconName
methods.sourceCode: systemIconName	^ #collectionIcon

methods.name: with:
methods.sourceCode: with: anObject 	"Answer an instance of me containing anObject."	^ self empty		add: anObject;		yourself

methods.name: isAbstract
methods.sourceCode: isAbstract	^self name = #Collection

methods.name: with:with:with:with:with:
methods.sourceCode: with: firstObject with: secondObject with: thirdObject with: fourthObject with: fifthObject	"Answer an instance of me, containing the five arguments as the elements."	^ self new		add: firstObject;		add: secondObject;		add: thirdObject;		add: fourthObject;		add: fifthObject;		yourself

methods.name: with:with:with:
methods.sourceCode: with: firstObject with: secondObject with: thirdObject 	"Answer an instance of me containing the three arguments as elements."	^ self new		add: firstObject;		add: secondObject;		add: thirdObject;		yourself

methods.name: with:with:
methods.sourceCode: with: firstObject with: secondObject 	"Answer an instance of me containing the two arguments as elements."	^ self new		add: firstObject;		add: secondObject;		yourself

methods.name: canonicalArgumentName
methods.sourceCode: canonicalArgumentName	^ 'aCollection'.

methods.name: approvedSelectorsForMethodFinder
methods.sourceCode: approvedSelectorsForMethodFinder	 ^ self selectors

methods.name: withAll:
methods.sourceCode: withAll: aCollection	"Create a new collection containing all the elements from aCollection."	^ (self new: aCollection size)		addAll: aCollection;		yourself

methods.name: empty
methods.sourceCode: empty	^ self new
